intro: Quadrella domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican quadrilla, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
